originalText: Although he was very tired but he decided to keep working because he don't want to fall behind. The weather was so hot, so I decided to not go outside, even though I had promised to meet my friend who is waited for me. She always have been interested in science, and her brother who is also liking physics encouraged her to study engineering. In the meeting yesterday, he say that he will finish the report by today, but he haven't send me anything yet. The book what I bought yesterday was very interesting, and I am plan to read more by same author.

sentenceFeedback.original: Although he was very tired but he decided to keep working because he don't want to fall behind.
sentenceFeedback.corrected: Although he was very tired, he decided to keep working because he didn't want to fall behind.

errors.error: Although he was very tired but
errors.reason: Redundant conjunction: 'but' is unnecessary after 'Although'.
errors.improvedClause: Although he was very tired, he decided to keep working

errors.reason: Incorrect verb form: 'don't' should match past tense.
errors.improvedClause: he didn't want to fall behind

sentenceFeedback.original: The weather was so hot, so I decided to not go outside, even though I had promised to meet my friend who is waited for me.
sentenceFeedback.corrected: The weather was so hot that I decided not to go outside, even though I had promised to meet my friend who was waiting for me.

errors.reason: Incorrect conjunction: 'so hot that' is the correct form.
errors.improvedClause: The weather was so hot that I decided not to go outside

errors.reason: Incorrect word order: 'not to go' is preferred.
errors.improvedClause: I decided not to go outside

errors.reason: Incorrect verb tense: 'is waited' is incorrect.
errors.improvedClause: my friend who was waiting for me

sentenceFeedback.original: She always have been interested in science, and her brother who is also liking physics encouraged her to study engineering.
sentenceFeedback.corrected: She has always been interested in science, and her brother, who also likes physics, encouraged her to study engineering.

errors.reason: Incorrect verb agreement: 'have' should be 'has' for singular subject.
errors.improvedClause: She has always been interested in science

errors.reason: Incorrect verb form: 'is liking' is unnatural.
errors.improvedClause: her brother, who also likes physics

sentenceFeedback.original: In the meeting yesterday, he say that he will finish the report by today, but he haven't send me anything yet.
sentenceFeedback.corrected: In the meeting yesterday, he said that he would finish the report by today, but he hasn't sent me anything yet.

errors.reason: Incorrect verb tense: 'say' should be past tense.
errors.improvedClause: he said that he would finish the report

errors.reason: Tense mismatch: 'will' should be 'would' to match past context.
errors.improvedClause: he said that he would finish the report by today

errors.reason: Incorrect verb form: 'haven't send' should be 'hasn't sent'.
errors.improvedClause: but he hasn't sent me anything yet

sentenceFeedback.original: The book what I bought yesterday was very interesting, and I am plan to read more by same author.
sentenceFeedback.corrected: The book that I bought yesterday was very interesting, and I plan to read more by the same author.

errors.reason: Incorrect relative pronoun: 'what' should be 'that'.
errors.improvedClause: The book that I bought yesterday

errors.reason: Incorrect verb form: 'am plan' is not correct.
errors.improvedClause: I plan to read more by the same author

errors.reason: Missing article: 'same author' needs 'the'.

originalText: He don't knows where is the keys, so he ask me to help him find it. The cat was laying on the table, and the books was scattered everywhere. She don't likes to eat vegetables, even though they is good for her health.
